summary: Stephen Narsoo is a city strategist & senior venture architect with +15 years of experience in; strategy development, business planning, quantitative and economic modelling. He has worked for PricewaterhouseCoopers and has managed senior consultant teams. He has been a staff member for the World Bank and International Finance Corporation. He has a Micro-Masters in Instructional Design & Technology (University of Maryland), MA in Urban Planning (UCLA) and BSc (City & Regional Planning) and the University of Witwatersrand. He is an expert in opportunity recognition and decision-making heuristics for nascent entrepreneurs. His research and academic interests are in the field of decision-making heuristics for new venture creation. He is also passionate about decision making under uncertainty, specifically complex decision making for cities.

projects.title: Investing in our Future-Johannesburg Social Housing Business Plan- 2020
projects.description:
A review of JOSHCO’s business plan was undertaken. Unique tools were used such as the Empathy Map and others to develop a business more customer/client focused. This resulted in a shift in thinking in the organisation. The plan was intricately aligned to Joburg 2040 the long term vision of the city. The Mayoral Committee adopted the plan in June 2014 and based on the plan allocated the largest budget in the country for social housing.

Impact: Three billion rand social housing stock to be developed in Johannesburg.

projects.title: Johannesburg's Street Food Incubator Project- Client Johannesburg Development Agency
projects.description:
There are thousands of necessity driven entrepreneurs on the streets of Johannesburg. Managing the influx of traders has been a problem of the city. But why not turn a problem into an opportunity. This business plan is the  first attempt as creating a street food business accelerator for the City of Johannesburg. The goal turn 10 necessity driven food entrepreneurs into viable street food businesses.

Impact: Two hundred direct and indirect jobs in two years. Ten viable street food businesses.

projects.title: Developing South Africa's Urban Innovation System- Client: National Advisory Council on innovation
projects.description:
Innovation lies at the heart of economic growth and competitiveness. Countries that have developed a culture around innovation and whose governments actively support innovation through policy remain innovation leaders. This study was an assessment of the South Africa’s innovation system and suggests a new framework for innovation in the country. The work was commissioned by the National Advisory Council on Innovation.

Impact: Practical response to the National Development Plan 2030.

projects.title: Exploring South Africa's National Design Landscape-Client South African Bureau of Standards
projects.description:
Design is critical for economic competitiveness. Hyundai, Audi, LG, Apple are companies that emerge from countries with strong national design systems. National design systems support designers, design institutions and governments actively promote design. This study was commissioned by the Design Institute (SABS) to explore South Africa’s National Design System and its competitiveness in relation to the rest of the world.

Impact: Raising awareness of the importance of design in economic competitiveness.

projects.title: Johannesburg Smart City Strategy
projects.description: Urban performance currently depends not only on the city's endowment of hard infrastructure ('physical capital'), but also, and increasingly so, on the availability and quality of knowledge communication and social infrastructure ('intellectual capital and social capital'). The latter form of capital is decisive for urban competitiveness. It is against this background that the concept of the smart city has been introduced in the City of Johannesburg to drive efficiency and competitiveness and to make the city more resource efficient.

projects.title: African Urban Wiki
projects.description:
African UrbanWiki, Client: World Bank:
African UrbanWiki is an online collaborative platform for African urban development practitioners to access, exchange and develop new knowledge across sectors. It is based on Web 2.0 technology. I drafted the first business plan for the portal. The African UrbanWiki portal was launched officially in 2012.

projects.title: Gauteng Global City Region Strategy, Client: Gauteng Province:
projects.description:
Gauteng Global City Region Strategy, Client: Gauteng Province
The Gauteng Global City Region Strategy is a strategy of Gauteng Province. It provided the impetus for the Gautrain and other regional projects. I provided research inputs into the strategy. The strategy was launched in 2006.

projects.title: Rustenburg City Development Strategy
projects.description:
Rustenburg City Development Strategy, Client: Rustenburg Municipality:
Rustenburg is one of the largest platinum producing regions in the world experiencing exponential population growth. To deal with long term growth the City undertook the drafting of its long term city development strategy. I provide research input and strategy facilitation to the process. The official document was launched as part of the North West Growth and Development Strategy.

projects.title: •	Johannesburg Medical Quarter, Client: Johannesburg Development Agency
projects.description:
Johannesburg Medical Quarter, Client: Johannesburg Development Agency
The aim of the project was to develop the Milpark Precinct into a world class medical quarter. I conducted research for the business plan which was completed; however the project was not implemented.

projects.title: Sectional Title Housing Pilot Project in Hillbrow/Berea
projects.description: The Hillbrow/Berea area commonly known as the ‘flatlands’ has the highest rate of building invasions & hijackings in South Africa. I developed a turnaround The programme focus was a housing turnaround strategy to restore the housing market and improve the management of low-income housing in the area.

contributors.headline: Local Government: Urban Development and Governance Specialist at GTAC (a National Treasury agency)

projects.title: •	Braamfontein Regeneration Strategy, Client: Johannesburg Development Agency
projects.description: Braamfontein Regeneration Strategy was a project to improve the property market in the business district. The current rejuvenation of the area and increase in property value is attributed to the strategy which was completed in 2006.

projects.title: •	Evaluation of National Land Reform Programme, Client: Dept. of Land Affairs
projects.description: Project involved a National assessment of Land Reform Programme. A randomized sample of a hundred projects in South Africa was taken. I was responsible for overall fieldwork coordination and data capturing.

projects.title: (United Nations Industrial Development Organisation) Bike Ride Share Scheme Operators Vetting
Joburg 2040 Sustainability Plan
projects.description: Johannesburg 2040 is a long term corporate strategy that defines the plans for the city of Johannesburg towards 2040. I was Manager and Chief Writer of the strategy. I led a 2 year research process to develop the strategy which included an intensive 8 week public consultation process that involved thousands of consultations. The official document was launched in Oct 2011. The Johannesburg 2040 process is currently being used a benchmark case study in city strategy making at the University of Lund (Sweden), Mcgill University (Canada) and Toulouse University (France).

contributors.headline: Director: Strategy & International Relations at City of Johannesburg
Executive Director at Gauteng City-Region Observatory
Group (Executive) Head: Strategy, Policy Coordination and Relations

projects.title: Madibeng Capacity Building Programme
projects.description: The program aims at building capacity of Madibeng to undertake strategic planning. Specifically to develop long term infrastructure plans. The project assisted the Municipality to develop budgets for short to medium term infrastructure planning projects. I was team Project Leader; the project came to an end as a result of budget constraints.

profile_positions.description:
Snr. Corporate Strategist:
- Led and managed the team to develop the Smart Cities Strategy for South Africa approved by Cabinet
- Managed funding partnerships with United Nations Industrial Corporation (UNIDO) and World Bank for 
  technology projects
- Designed operational structures and institutional arrangements for the implementation of projects
- Analysis of regulatory environment and recommendations on legislative and regulatory changes for smart city enablement.

        University of Toulouse (France) and University College London.
